channel.title: Sections on Mikey Jarrell
channel.description: Recent content in Sections on Mikey Jarrell

item.description: I’m an economics PhD student at UC San Diego. I study development economics to try to improve the lives of the poor. I have a master’s in Data, Economics, and Development Policy from MIT, where I was a teaching and research assistant to Esther Duflo.

Education Ph.D. in Economics, University of Californa San Diego, 2029 (expected) M.A.Sc. in Data, Economics, and Development Policy, Massachusetts Intitute of Technology, 2022 B.S. in Romance Languages and Neuroscience, Bowdoin College, 2014 Relevant Experience 2022–23: Teaching and Research Assistant to Esther Duflo (MIT) 2017–19: Project Manager (2020 MicroClinic Initiative — Nairobi, Kenya) Skills Coding: Stata, R, LaTeX Languages: English (native), Spanish (fluent), French (proficient) Italian (proficient), Portuguese (conversational) Other Experience

As Instructor MIT DEDP Master’s: Math Camp (Spring 2023) Topics covered include probability, causal inference, and empirical strategies. Sample lecture. As Teaching Assistant MIT 14.75/14.750: Political Economy and Economic Development (Spring 2023) TA for Esther Duflo and Sara Lowes Rated 6.3 out of 7 by students on anonymous course evaluations. Sample lecture. MIT 14.73: Challenges of Global Poverty (Fall 2022) TA for Esther Duflo and Frank Schilbach Rated 6.6 out of 7 by students on anonymous course evaluations.

item.title: Previous Lives
item.description: Golf: I’m a member of World Long Drive and Ultimate Long Drive with a career longest shot of 429 yards and highest World Ranking of 17. I set an amateur world record with a 400 yard drive to win the 2019 Latino Americao Championship. The highlight of my career was losing by four yards Bryson DeChambeau in the 2021 World Championships. Film: Videos that I’ve written, shot, directed, edited, and produced are at Average Content.
